DataElement.preferredName: Blood Cell Count Laboratory Procedure Timepoint Day 21 Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a blood cell count laboratory procedure was performed on day twenty-one.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Cell Count Laboratory Procedure Timepoint Day 21 Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::21_Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood.  Also called complete blood count (CBC).:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a biospecimen.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::21:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Executed and carried through to completion.
